column1: #Text=U2 tour manager , Dennis Sheehan dies in Los Angeles hotel room at 68
#Text=, U2 ' s tour manager , died in his Los Angeles hotel room on Wednesday at 68 years of age .
#Text=In their second show at the Los Angeles Forum , U2 paid tribute to their tour manager .
#Text=According to The Guardian , in-between songs U2 's lead singer Bono reflected on Sheehan 's life to the audience , saying how he was family to the band .
#Text=Bono said , " U2 's family — it 's a brotherhood , although there 's a lot of sisters in it too ... but the extended family is very important to us and we look after each other .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=During the show , Bono also added ,  A lot of U2 songs over the years were written to fill a void , an absence , a hole in a heart left by a loved one .

_	_	_	_

#Text=According to Rolling Stone , Sheehan was with the Irish band U2 on their five-day Los Angeles tour .

#Text= Arthur Fogel , Chairman of Global Touring for Live Nation Entertainment also stated his thoughts on the loss of Sheehan : " With profound sadness we confirm that Dennis Sheehan , U2 's longstanding tour manager and dear friend to us all , has passed away overnight .

column1: #Text=Our heartfelt sympathy is with his wonderful family .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=U2 are currently on their international  Innocence and Experience " tour which concludes in November .
